title: Paul Marquet
text:
Paul Marquet (born 26 September 1969 in <a href="Newcastle%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Newcastle, New South Wales</a>) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1990s and 2000s. He played primarily as a for Australian clubs the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>, <a href="Hunter%20Mariners">Hunter Mariners</a> and <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a>, and for English club, the <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a>.
Early life.
Born in <a href="Newcastle%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Newcastle, New South Wales</a>. Paul played junior rugby league for <a href="Raymond%20Terrace%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Raymond Terrace, New South Wales</a>.
Plaring career.
A resilient , Marquet participated in seven finals series and two <a href="Grand%20Final">Grand Final</a>s, the most memorable being his appearance as a for the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> in the <a href="1999%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">1999 NRL Grand Final</a>, played on his 30th birthday. Having won the 1999 Premiership, the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> traveled to England to contest the <a href="2000%20World%20Club%20Challenge">2000 World Club Challenge</a> against <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> Champions <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St Helens R.F.C.</a>, with Marquet playing as a in the victory. He played for the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> from the interchange bench in their <a href="2001%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">2001 NRL Grand Final</a> victory over the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a>.
